medical_history.chief_complaint: Anemia and gastrointestinal symptoms leading to a diagnosis of celiac disease.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Ms. J has been anemic since her first pregnancy 20 years ago. Recently, she reported inability to tolerate iron due to constipation, much lighter menses, and intermittent epigastric discomfort. Her symptoms led to an endoscopy referral. In March 2010, her hematocrit was found to be 26%.
medical_history.family_history: Family history of colon cancer; her daughter was tested for celiac disease with a negative result.
medical_history.social_history: Ms. J does not smoke or drink alcohol. She experiences difficulties eating out and shopping for gluten-free products.
